text:
Lesparre-Médoc () is a commune in the Gironde department in Nouvelle-Aquitaine region in southwestern France. It is one of the five sub-prefectures of the department.
Geography.
Lesparre-Médoc is on the Médoc peninsula on left side of the estuary of the Garonne river. The city is at about north of Bordeaux.
It has an area of, and its average altitude is; at the city hall, the altitude is.
Climate.
The climate of Lesparre-Médoc is Marine West Coast Climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb), with mild winters and warm summers.
Population.
The inhabitants of Lesparre-Médoc are known, in French, as "Lesparrains" (women: "Lesparraines").
With a population of 5,604, Lesparre-Médoc has a population density of inhabitants/km2.
Evolution of the population in Lesparre-Médoc
Administration.
Lesparre-Médoc is a sub-prefecture of the Gironde department. It is also the capital of the "arrondissement" of Lesparre-Médoc and the administrative centre () of the "canton" of Le Nord-Médoc with 39,923 inhabitants (2014).
It is part of the intercommunality "Médoc Cœur de Presqu'ile" ().
